label: A2B3C8D_tP14_123_h_bg_egi_c-001
title: Tetragonal Ba$_{2}$YCu$_{3-x}$O$_{7-y}$ Structure
comments:
This is the high temperature phase of Ba$_{2}$YCu$_{3-x}$O$_{7-y}$, stable above 575$^\circ$C. (Nakai, 1987a). At lower temperatures is transforms into the superconducting \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B3C7D_oP13_47_k_cj_aijl_f-001}{orthorhombic 1212C structure}. 
 As with all of the high-T$_{c}$ cuprates there is considerable disorder.  In this sample the copper site has 9\% vacancies, and the O I (2e) site has 20\% occupation, givin $x = 0.6$. 
 In some compounds the Cu I and Cu II sites are occupied by different species.  The ICSD lists these under the Ba$_{2}$YCu$_{3-x}$O$_{7-y}$ prototype, but we have separated those compounds out, creating the \href{current_web_home_dir/A2BC2DE6_tP12_123_h_c_g_b_gi-001}{Hg-1212} prototype. 
 AFLOW shifted the origin of the experimental report of the structure, moving the Cu I atom from the (1a) to the (1b) site.
